articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: That weird World Cup time is almost over and the quarter-finals are upon us. By the time Brazil and Croatia kick-off the first of four captivating ties over and Friday and Saturday, we’ll have been starved of football at the game's biggest event for 64 hours and six minutes.
articles.title: Qatar World Cup has already ticked plenty boxes - can it now become one of the greats?

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic have already added two players to Ange Postecoglou's squad ahead of the January transfer window and it could be a busy month in the east end of Glasgow.
articles.title: Celtic transfer latest: Target's hint, Euro giants eye Parkhead star, battle for £4m international playmaker

articles.description: Celtic have been heavily linked with a move for South Korea World Cup star Cho Gue-sung and now the player's father has had his say on his next transfer destination.
articles.title: Cho Gue-sung to Celtic: South Korea World Cup star's father has say on transfer destination

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Josip Juranovic took time out of Croatia’s celebrations following their World Cup win over Japan to console his Celtic team-mate Daizen Maeda on the pitch.
articles.title: Josip Juranovic reveals what he said to Celtic team-mate Daizen Maeda during emotional World Cup moment

articles.description: There was always going to be particular fascination for followers of Scottish football’s big two as Croatia squared up to Japan in the World Cup last 16.

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: On Sunday afternoon Olivier Giroud became France’s all-time top scorer with a goal in his country’s 3-1 win over Poland in the last-16 of the 2022 World Cup. It was his 52nd strike in 117 caps.
articles.title: When Celtic nearly signed Olivier Giroud, stuff of dreams, legendary stadium, phone call, Kilmarnock contempt

articles.description: Former Celtic defender Charlie Mulgrew has discussed his plans to move into coaching when he hangs up his boots. The Dundee United veteran has used the time spent on the sidelines as well as the World Cup break to get his beginnings in the coaching world.Speaking to The Daily Record, Mulgrew spoke of his player-coach role Read More

articles.description: No doubt you are like me, and beginning to pine for the “real” football season to begin again. The World Cup is all very well – in fact it has been surprisingly good and surprisingly well organised by our oil-rich friends – but my main concern has been that no Celtic player gets injured, and Read More

articles.description: Former Celtic midfielder Roy Keane is a vocal pundit, often quick to make his opinions heard. The Irishman is currently working with ITV covering the World Cup in Qatar but showed what he can do on the park as the team made the most of the days between action.Keane produced a hilarious moment as he Read More

articles.description: The World Cup in Qatar has attempted to satisfy the lack of Celtic action; however, there is just over a week remaining until the Scottish Champions are back in action. articles.description: The Celtic media team asked their followers on Twitter earlier today who has been player of the season so far. There has been, as is usually the case with this Celtic team, a mixed response of answers to this question. Some say Reo Hatate, others think Greg Taylor and some say Jota. All these names Read More

articles.description:
The World Cup might still be going on, but we’re fully back in Celtic mode ten days out from the bhoys returning to action. There are four games to be played before the second Glasgow Derby of the season — we’re in no way discounting those games and know Celtic are in for a tough […]

articles.description: Tonight, there’s a story doing the rounds about Mark Guidi saying that Giakoumakis not unhappy with the money on offer in his new deal but that he might be slightly miffed about his status within the Celtic team itself. Could it really be that simple? Guidi has contacts within football, and he might be in […]
articles.title: Is Giakoumakis Unsettled Because He’s Not Celtic’s Starting Striker?

articles.description:
There are a lot of Celtic games coming up thick and fast. The bhoys will be in action a day before the World Cup is wrapped up when they are on Aberdeen at Pittodrie. After that, there’s a quick turnover for a double header at Celtic Park against Livingston then St Johnstone before Christmas. The […]

articles.description:
Celtic have been relatively quiet on social media the past few days. They popped up earlier on Wednesday to engage the supporters in some debate about who has been the best player for the Hoops so far this term. The bhoys are on a break due to the World Cup but are due back in […]

articles.description: In his wonderful song “Quite Ugly One Morning” Warren Zevon wrote bitterly that, “From dawn to sundown it’s a long, long way. And it’s a hollow triumph when you make it to the bottom of another day.” He was writing about his personal experiences as an alcoholic, but all of us can recognise a little […]
articles.title: Ibrox Accepts Defeat On Contract Renewals And Braces For A Multi-Million Pound Hit.

articles.description:
Celtic’s training camp out in Portugal could prove to be an important mid-season opportunity for several members of Ange Postecoglou’s squad. With the Bhoys’ return to action later this month edging closer, preparations are beginning to ramp up ahead of the second half of the campaign. In order to make sure his players are ready ...

articles.description:
DAIZEN MAEDA and Japan exited the World Cup earlier this week after Croatia got the win on penalties in the end. It was Celtic vs Celt when Daizen came up against Josip Juranovic and they both did their countries proud. In the end, Croatia did enough to get through to the quarter final of the […]

Pundit Mark Guidi believes the Giakoumakis rumours doing the rounds during the World Cup are more about his position in the team than about money. News came out last week the Celtic striker could leave in January after contract talks broke down. The reason given at the time was Giak was told his Celtic deal […]

Cristiano Ronaldo, sat on the bench, was not smiling. He looked like someone who had witnessed […]
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Rage Against The Dying Of The Light.

Some have been great results, others have been gutwrenching – such as the loss on penalties versus Valencia.Thanks to LilZe on Twitter, we are able to travel back in time and revisit games Read More

articles.description:
It has been reported that La Liga side Atletico Madrid are planning a scouting trip to the World Cup to watch Celtic defender Josip Juranovic [Football Scotland]. The 27-year-old has been linked to moves away from the Hoops in recent months with Atletico supposedly showing interest in the former Legia Warsaw star during the summer. […]

Filip Benković has been linked with several moves back to Glasgow since his loan spell at the club four seasons ago, but he is currently applying his trade in Germany. His talent shone through along with his drive and determination. The Japanese forward cut a maligned figure Read More

articles.description:
Former Celtic striker Charlie Nicholas has blasted the return of Peter Lawwell to the club after it was announced that he would succeed Ian Bankier as Chairman. Lawwell was involved with the club for almost 18 years and was a very divisive figure during his reign as Chief Executive. Celtic experience great success but imploded […]

articles.description:
Alistair Johnston signed for Celtic at the weekend. The Canadian signed a five-year deal with the Hoops, moving from MLS side Montreal. The last time Celtic tried to dip into the American/Canadian market under Brendan Rodgers, the plan went horribly wrong. If you remember the names Andrew Gutman and Manny Perez, you’ll probably remember the […]

I will always be grateful to their team for giving me that opportunity. The most important article I wrote for them, and maybe the most important I have written or […]
articles.title: It’s Now Clear This Ibrox Club Is In Dire Straits. Celtic Must Stick The Hose In Their Mouth.

articles.description:
Celtic forward Daizen Maeda has taken to social media after his World Cup heroics for Japan [@M_daizen_1020]. 初めてのW杯。これまで出会った方々、所属したチーム、家族、ファン、サポーター、沢山のサポートがあったからこそこの舞台に立てました。四年後。必ずリベンジします。沢山の応援本当にありがとうございました。これからも宜しくお願いします。#FIFAWorldCup pic.twitter.com/2PIxgE4GXU — 前田 大然 Daizen Maeda (@M_daizen_1020) December 6, 2022 The 25-year-old was a regular starter for his national team at the tournament and scored the opening goal in their Last 16 tie against Croatia.  His message […]

articles.title: Daizen Maeda Shares World Cup Social Media Message

articles.description: Former Celtic star Charlie Nicholas is concerned at what is happening at Celtic, believing the stall on new deals for key players could impact the future of Ange Postecoglou.  The Lowdown: Big players, little returns Amidst the current debacle on the contract front for key players like Josip Juranovic and Giorgos Giakoumakis, Nicholas feels both […]
articles.title: Charlie Nicholas alarmed by what he's hearing from Celtic, could force Ange to do a Rodgers

articles.description: Today, one of the worst kept secrets in Ibrox was confirmed to their fans; the era of directors funding the club out of their own pockets by trading cold hard cash for increasingly worthless shares is at an end. The next time a director puts his hand in his pockets to fund the mad fantasises […]
articles.title: An Ibrox Director Has Confirmed Their Fans Worst Fear About Continued Funding.

articles.description: The Mooch got a standing ovation today at the Ibrox AGM. He should have gotten two; one from the floor and the other from the board. He fulfilled his primary role quite brilliantly at that meeting; he gave the fans something to cheer and the board an easy ride. I’ll go into some detail for […]
articles.title: The Ibrox Board Gets An Easy Ride As “Stormy” AGM Turns Into A Love In For The Mooch.

David’s latest bestseller The Celtic Rising ~ 1965 The Year Jock Stein Changed Everything has SOLD OUT on Celtic Star Books but you can still pick up a copy Read More
articles.title: Celtic On This Day – 6th December – David Potter’s Celtic Diary

Last […]

Details have been released about Celtic’s friendly against French side Rennes with the game scheduled for December, 10 at 10am Celtic Park time [Rennes].  After extending their lead at the top of the SPFL Premiership to nine points, Celtic travelled to Australia to take on Sydney FC and Everton in Ange Postecoglou’s homecoming before getting […]

articles.description: A Bond villain once remarked to 007 that he re-appeared “with the tedious inevitability of an unloved season”.  I suspect that more than a few Celtic supporters felt the same at the news of Peter Lawwell’s return to the Celtic boardroom,   When he announced that he was leaving, many of us wondered if it […]

articles.description: In spite of the hype in the papers, Ibrox’s board faces an uncomfortable morning tomorrow but not a threatening one. They will get some stick and they’ll be asked some hard questions but they are going to get through it unscathed. There are questions they should be asked but won’t be. Much of the heat […]

Australian legend Mark Schwarzer has refuted the assumption Ange Postecoglou is heading for a job in the English Premier League shortly, feeling that he will leave on good terms with Celtic. Former Celtic captain Paul Lambert is relishing the return of Callum McGregor to the Bhoys starting line-up later this month, insisting that the midfielder will keep standards high despite a nine-point lead in the table.
